meanings.definition: A person who works on land owned by someone else in exchange for a share of the crops produced.
meanings.sent1: The sharecrops harvested the corn and took a portion home.
meanings.sent2: The sharecrops were happy to receive a part of the harvest for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The sharecrops joked about dividing the crops with the landowner.
meanings.sent4: In the field of sharecrops, each worker is like a seed, growing together.
meanings.sent5: The sharecrops toiled under the sun, reaping what they sowed.

meanings.sent1: She decided to sharecrops on the farm to earn a living.
meanings.sent2: Many families sharecrops to support themselves.
meanings.sent3: He sharecrops with dedication and pride.
meanings.sent4: The community sharecrops together, creating a bond.
meanings.sent5: Sharecropping requires hard work and commitment from those who sharecrop.

meanings.sent1: Sharecropping was a common way for farmers to work the land.
meanings.sent2: The history books often mention the practice of sharecropping.
meanings.sent3: In the past, sharecropping was a way for many to make a living.
meanings.sent4: The system of sharecropping shaped the agricultural landscape.
meanings.sent5: Sharecropping changed the dynamics of land ownership in rural areas.
